definitions.definition: a space from which most or all of the matter has been removed, or where there is little or no matter

examples: The withdrawal of troops from the area has created a security vacuum which will need to be filled.

definitions.definition: kept separate from other people and activities:
examples: No artist works in a vacuum - we are all of us influenced by others.

definitions.definition: to use a vacuum cleaner to collect dust, dirt, etc.:
examples: Vacuum (up) the cake crumbs, would you?
